greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Well-order the rational numbers; take numerators.
reference: W. Sierpiński, Cardinal and Ordinal Numbers, Warsaw 1965, 2nd ed., p. 40.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
mathematica: order[n_] := Join[-Reverse[ pos = Select[(r = Range[n])/Reverse[r], Numerator[#] + Denominator[#] == n + 1 & ] ], pos]; order[0] = 0; Numerator[ Flatten[ Table[ order[n], {n, 0, 10}]]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 27 2012 *)
program: (concat $ concat $ transpose [map (map negate) qss, map reverse qss])
q x = map (uncurry (%)) $ filter ((== 1) . uncurry gcd) $
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
